meanings.def: a substance that causes death or harm if it gets into the body
examples: Some mushrooms contain a deadly poison.
How did he die? Was it poison?
The dog was killed by rat poison (= poison intended to kill rats).
to hunt with poison arrows
bombs containing poison gas
She had laced his drink with poison.

meanings.def: an idea, a feeling, etc. that is extremely harmful
examples: the poison of racial hatred
These words were pure poison to me.
groups that are spreading the poison of sectarianism

meanings.def: used to say that different people like different things; what one person likes very much, another person does not like at all
used to ask somebody what alcoholic drink they would like

idioms.idiom: one man’s meat is another man’s poison
idioms.def: used to say that different people like different things; what one person likes very much, another person does not like at all
used to ask somebody what alcoholic drink they would like

related: one man’s meat is another man’s poison

meanings.def: to harm or kill a person or an animal by giving them poison
examples: poison somebody/yourself He was believed to poison his enemies.
Thousands are at risk of being poisoned by fumes from faulty heaters.
Poisoning the rats is expensive and harmful to the environment.
poison somebody/yourself with something In the last chapter, she poisons herself with arsenic.

meanings.def: to put poison in or on something
examples: poison something a poisoned arrow
Someone had been poisoning his food.
Large sections of the river have been poisoned by toxic waste from factories.
Exhaust fumes are poisoning our cities.
poison something with something The chocolates had been poisoned with cyanide.

meanings.def: to have a bad effect on something
examples: His comment served only to poison the atmosphere still further.
She succeeded in poisoning their minds against me.
I hope that if we do have disagreements they won't poison our relationship.

meanings.def: a thing that seems attractive when it is given to somebody but which soon becomes unpleasant
examples: He inherited a poisoned chalice when he took over the job as union leader.

idioms.def: a thing that seems attractive when it is given to somebody but which soon becomes unpleasant
examples: He inherited a poisoned chalice when he took over the job as union leader.
